Reviews.Title: “A B&B instead of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: nikendayu
Reviews.Content: Just came back from 3 weeks Europe trip and I've been stayed at 3 and 4 star hotel in various place, so far, this hotel was the worst. Staying in its Minerva room type really didnt give us a pleasant stay. The most terrible was its bathroom, I never found any hotel separated its toilette and shower room. The shower room was so tiny (the width is as small as cupboard) and it was separated with toilette, meaning that after took shower you have to towel in bed room or run into toilet by passing the bed room. The wall was thin that you could hear people walking outside the corridor, definitely not a hotel for light sleeper. Breakfast was bad, 2 selection of cereal, milk, 2 selection of cakes, 2 selection of pastries, egg, ham, bacon and bread. Though they served cereals, but they didn't give cereal spoon, so we used tea spoon. The breakfast attendance staff couldn't speak english properly. The good thing is its location that close to major attraction, such as trevi fountain, colosseum, Emanuel Monument.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on central Roma”
Reviews.Author: Fredy_Marx
Reviews.Content: This hotel is probably the very best compromise between price/location/comfort in central Rome - it sits 25m walk from as far as pizza Spagna, to piazza popolo, to the Forum and Colosseum, up to the Vatican city. it's not cheap, but it makes up for it with the comfort of the location. i you thought you needed X days to see the town - with this one, you may just make it in X-1 days. the hotel spreads throughout the whole building, sharing functions with a spa/cosmetic centre [no nasty smells though], plus a restaurant at ground floor. there are about 3-4 bedrooms per floor above 1st, and mine was facing the small inner courtyard - which for one side was good for quiet [very indeed], but i couldn't get any decent views to the square. the breakfast was pretty good, not wholesome, but far from frugal - i've specially liked the scrambled eggs and the sweet croissants! the only downside i found was the cleaner's store right across from my front door, associated with the wafer thin walls - i could not only hear the cleaning crew getting set, but also the next door guest taking a shower. further to this, the TV system was absolutely infuriating. mix between digital tv and analogue, took too much to start up, and far more even to change between channels. for something that should be a no-brainer, this took quite a lot to get to grips with. all in all, it was a very good trip, and i'd recommend the hotel to anyone wanting to stay central and walk the city.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: warzasaw
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with a great location right outside the doorsteps of the Pantheon in Piazza Della Rotonda. The rooms were amazingly clean and modern, and the staff were more than accommodating. If you're planning a` trip to Rome i highly recommend this Hotel, you get what you pay for, guaranteed

Reviews.Title: “Good Location. Walking Distance to All Major Attractions”
Reviews.Author: kkandie22
Reviews.Content: The hotel is exactly where it says it is. Literally on the doorsteps of the Pantheon which is a great way to walk out o the hotel every morning. The room, however, is very small and the toilet and shower are so close together it's difficult to go to the bathroom or take a shower because it's very petite. The restaurants around are very pushy so if you're not planning on eating at them I would suggest you not make eye contact. The horse carriages outside will probably try to tell you 150 euros and when you walk away (which I hope you do) they'll keep lowering the price or try to tell you 70 euros one way to the Colosseum which is literally about a 10-15 minute walk so don't take it unless you just feel like burning money. Realistically, you could walk to all sites, the Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Vatican City, etc, but it doesn't cost too much by taxi either so if you're not in the mood for a stroll I'd suggest doing that. I only had a problem with one taxi driver who tried to have the meter running before we even got in and also tried to charge a "bag" fee of 4 euros when he took the bag out of our hands as we put them in ourselves so be careful. I thought the food in Italy would have been more appetizing, but had a really hard time finding quality food so you may want to research that before you go. I wouldn't recommend any of the restaurants outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: natk4
Reviews.Content: Requested a deluxe room and loved it. Had a fantastic view of the Pantheon and square. Great staff, good breakfast. Would stay here again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location but.....”
Reviews.Author: nozza007
Reviews.Content: Absolutely great location and within the square some decent places for pizza/pasta etc. We were told we were upgraded from a standard room, well if that was an upgrade best to go for top of the range. The bed could be electronically raised to reveal a jacuzzi! No thank you, may appeal to my teenage children. The room was incredibly small you had to turn sideways to pass by the bed, there were no drawers or shelves in the room and the wardrobe was a single and each garment had to go in front of the other and on those dreadful fixed and difficult to use hangers. non hanging clothes i placed on a chair as the suitcase did not fit anywhere - we had to keep moving it to the bathroom and out again. The bathroom was tiny a one person only room, a shower was in a separate cubicle in the room hidden by a broken shower door and broken curtain. The room curtains didn't close properly either. I asked if other rooms had better wardrobe facilities i.e. shelves and bigger and was told every room had the same - I know this is not true as our friends had a slightly bigger wardrobe but still no shelves, there must be better rooms and I would strongly advise getting a better one. Tea and coffee facilities in the room but once used they were never replenished until I phoned down. Staff were lovely, well most of them! Great overlooking the Pantheon but also pretty noisy so unless you want to stare out of the window go for a room at the back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Hotel was spotless!”
Reviews.Author: Seamus G
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a super location and is a perfect stay in Rome. Everything is walking distance and I think it is great value for money. The only slight issue I would have is that one of the receptionists is not as friendly as the others and she would benefit from a little smile or quick hello to the guests as they come in. However, overall I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and would defo reccommend it to anyone visiting!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a great price”
Reviews.Author: Yaniv M
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews here, I decided to take the shot, and try this hotel myself. Thanks to the reviews I ordered the Deluxe Room - which was a good surprise for us. The room was big, it even has a small TV room with a sofa. The cleanliness of the room was very good opposite to other reviews in here. One problem is with the acoustic isolation - you can easily hear people walking in the hotel's corridor.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Giorgos K
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, the staff was very helpful. Breakfast was average. The position was exceptional, in the pantheon plaza!I would reccomend it without doubt!!!

Reviews.Title: “View is amazing (at least from outside), tough to find at midnight if you've never been to Rome”
Reviews.Author: NJB198
Reviews.Content: The best view from the hotel, is actually right before you enter the front door (that is if you can find it). While we were there, significant remodeling is being done, making the actually entrance to the hotel difficult to find, especially if this is your first trip to Rome. The room was clean, albeit it very small - and we actually had quite a smell from our bathroom sewer - upon notifying the front desk and asking for a fan or how to remove the smell, they just stopped by and said to turn on the AC (although definitely not needed in November). Unfortunately the smell stayed the entire weekend and we just tried to keep the bathroom door closed as much as possible. Breakfast is good, the scenes outside even better, and the hotel is convenient. On next visit to Rome, not sure if I'd stay here - unless booking it oustide of Expedia / Travelocity / Orbitz as it appears that "package deal" bookings get far less priority than direct booked rooms. Note - the room that the hotel placed us in was a fully interior room, with a window (high in the wall) to the hallway.

Reviews.Title: “nice and perfect position”
Reviews.Author: flashMilan
Reviews.Content: I've benn at this hotel for a week end. The hotel is really nice and well located (you can reach all the interesting area in few minutes walking). Breakfast was good and served at the first foor with a nice view on the square of Pantheon. My room was a normal one, small but really nice. The courtesy of the staff

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: JennyLea
Reviews.Content: We have just enjoyed a 3 night stay at the Pantheon Royal Suite, Rome. The location was wonderful and our room (Deluxe) overlooked The Pantheon and Square where there was always lots of activity and a really good tenor singing each late afternoon. There was always a police presence in the Square which we thought was good. Windows were double glazed, but thin bedroom walls allowed noisy neighbours to badly affect our sleep on one of the nights. The bedroom and shower room, although small, were adequate and immaculately clean. Feather pillows did not suit us because of allergies, but they were instantly changed for non-allergenic ones. Breakfast consisted of cereals, fruit, ham/cheese/breads, bacon/scrambled eggs, preserves, pastries which we enjoyed. The Reception staff were very helpful, although it would have been advantageous to know that on visits to some of the tourist sights eg. Colosseum, age 65 and over or under 18 could have paid a reduced entrance fee on production of identity card or passport. Drinks very expensive in the Square ie small red wine and medium beer 17 euros. Very central for sightseeing. Quite difficult to locate Hotel as there was no signage and there is a Hotel Pantheon overlooking the Square as well which may confuse. We located it by the address 7 Rotonda.

Reviews.Title: “Best Room is Quite Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: RCJB
Reviews.Content: I do not usually write reviews but wanted to say that this hotel did everything right during my stay. If you are going to the trouble of staying on the Piazza Della Rotunda, go the extra distance and book one of the better rooms: The classic Hotel Minerva around the corner does not have a view of the piazza and its basic rooms are the price of the best room at the Royal Suites. I was very satisfied with the service and the staff were eager to please. I booked a room for my girlfriend's 29th birthday and arranged for a bottle of Moet to be awaiting us when we arrived. The staff automatically upgraded us to the Round Dreams suite, with a private elevator and two balconies overlooking the Piazza Della Rotunda. All was very well laid out and the staff offered us every consideration at all hours. From reading some of the other reviews I can say that the room was very clean and spacious. I cannot comment on the breakfast as we ate out. I have rarely known a hotel to recommend good restaurants: best to do your own research ahead of time. All things considered, I would endorse this hotel and particularly the better rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel!!!! Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: joepa1
Reviews.Content: The only thing good about this hotel is the location, everything else is TERRIBLE, poor service, terrible cheap breakfast anddirty rooms. Additionally, they provide poor recommendations to places to eat that are are good. I am a world traveller and this was a teriible experience.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location great hotel”
Reviews.Author: stormjordan
Reviews.Content: I can only comment on my experience. i booked this hotel as a birthday gift for my boyfriend for his 30th as he always wanted to go to Rome I booked the Pantheon Delux as I really wanted a special view. I panicked a little reading the reviews just days before we were to stay but I had nothing to worry about. I arranged wine and fruit to be in our room when we arrived, this was done and both were lovely. The airport transfers we asked for were arranged and both taxi drivers were on time and very helpful with carrying my bag and opening my door for me. We arrived before check in and our room wasnt ready but our details were taken and so were our bags. We arrived back later to be handed our key card. We got a little stuck finding the right corridor to our room but a member of helpful staff took us to the right room and showed us the use of the key card. There our bags had been taken to our room for us, lovely. The shower is in the room which i found different but actually my partner and I just smiled at the novelty of it and the shower space was fine as my boyfriend is a broad shouldered 6ft 3 bloke and had no issues. He had more space in that shower than our own at home!!! The smallest bit of space in the room was between the end of the bed and the wall but i even struggle to call that a negative. Plenty of room for our bags and hanging space available similar to he space you would find in any Holiday Inn in the UK. the mini bar was fully re-stocked each day and the rooms were cleaned and tidy. Even the floors cleaned, as we often came back from breakfast to find our room had just been done and you could see where they had mopped up. Talking of breakfast, it's not quite like we would have in the UK but then again we werent in the UK! It was nice to have the ham and cheese and the sweet cakes they had. My boyfriend had their bacon eggs and sausages and as someone who travels every week as part of his job he knows a good breakfast when he has one, he enjoyed it all, and the coffee was lovely. The staff at breakfast were very helpful and the room was not in a closed sticky smelly room. It was in the room you see on the website. All staff were more than helpful in my booking and during our stay. Even when I needed a corkscrew for our wine the member of staff who didnt speak much more English than I did Italian was most helpful in finding me the corkscrew. We had no issues with levels of noise from rooms next door and yes you could hear people if they passed your door and were talking but not any different to again any other hotel or being at home in my semi-detached and I sometimes hear my neighbour. The biggest noise would be the cleaners but they only started cleaning at the sort of time we were getting up anyways so this was not a bother. The restuarant just at the right served great food and we hadnt realised on the special discount, but when the restuarant staff saw which hotel we returned to then came after us to give us back the money we should have been discounted. The wireless was brilliant and we were able to skype our parents and give them a guided tour of our room and our view!!! Our jacuzzi waqs much needed after walking the sites of Rome. Location was fabulous and yes their were the street musicians and singers in the day and night but we found this added to the atmosphere and really enjoyed it. The windows did keep out the noise when time for sleep and what a comfortable bed to sleep on. I could go on with praise I really could. Will recommend the hotel and will stay there again. I would however based on my experience and other reviews only ever book the pantheon delux room. Thank you for making our holiday everything we could have wished for.

Reviews.Title: “Keep away”
Reviews.Author: Christine C
Reviews.Content: Agree with many of the previous reviews. Overpriced, breakfast terrible and the smallest and darkest room. Only the location is good. Also the recommendation I was given for dinner was rubbish (restaurant to left outside the hotel door). Keep away, far better places to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull stay! Don't believe to previous reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie D
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for our 10th wedding anniversary, and it was perfect! We booked a Pantheon Deluxe room on their website and we had a wide, comfortable, modern and very clean room facing the square with the Pantheon. In the room there was also a jacuzzi under the bed. We really spent a pleasant time at this hotel and would be happy to come again. The staff is professional and very kind with all or request. Do not believe to previous reviews, they have many room types, just choose what you like better! Location is fantastic and the hotel was up to our expectations!! thank you guys

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: marciavicente
Reviews.Content: I agreed completely with the last review: "The Pantheon royal suite was a bad experience. Rooms are terribly small and overprized. As for the first night I had a room without a window (...) I asked for a change and got a room on a higher floor. Just next to the noisy airconditionning tower, but at least with a window. On the internet the hotel looks great, but in real it is really not what you are expecting. Breakfast is terrible - in a closed room, sticky and smelly! Why don't they serve breakfast on the terrasse downstairs? Food isn't presented in a nice way and service is extremly unfriendly. I wouldn't go back there. " It's was a really sad experience."

Reviews.Title: “only the location is perfect”
Reviews.Author: COKandersteg
Reviews.Content: The Pantheon royal suite was a sad experience. Rooms are terribly small and overprized. As for the first night I had a room without a window (...) I asked for a change and got a room on a higher floor. Just next to the noisy airconditionning tower, but at least with a window. On the internet the hotel looks great, but in real it is really not what you are expecting. Breakfast is terrible - in a closed room, sticky and smelly! Why don't they serve breakfast on the terrasse downstairs? Food isn't presented in a nice way and service is extremly unfriendly. I wouldn't go back there.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel in Rome... Never, ever again..”
Reviews.Author: EElicious
Reviews.Content: The Pantheon Royal Suite = Unfriendly and rude staff,extremely tiny rooms,one step size shower,5 cm window, no view and small elevator, over priced hotel. Please do not book this hotel.It is not what you see on the website.If you look at the pictures photos have been taking in special lens to make the room and hotel look big and nice. Extremely bad hotel experience. 280 per night, they are out of their mind with this unfriendly, tiny 4 Stars ( it shouldn't have even 2 stars ) boutique ( they call them self Boutique:)) ) Hotel doesn't deserve a penny. We arrived the hotel and they gave us tiny room with smell of painting. They painted the rooms and expected that guests can stay in the smelly rooms. Are they mad??? We complain and they moved us an OTHER HOTEL at 10 pm. They said the hotel we are going to stay has same standarts and price will be same, They send us 3 Stars hotel instead of 4 Stars and price of the hotel was 160 Euros per a night. Do you know what they did , Pantheon Royal Suite wanted to charge 280 Euros per a night for the other hotel. Of course we didn't pay 280 , we paid the price that listed in the other hotel but this took our 4 hours with stress. Poor attitude of staff and management. Annoying thing was they thing they are right to charge 280 Euro per a night that we DID NOT STAY in the hotel.This was done in a very unfriendly and rude manner. The staff walked around with an attitude. Staff did not deal with problems effectively as we complained and no response. Bad points of this hotel: *The breakfast was absolutely awful. Worst coffee I've ever had The food is not served hot and freshly cooked. Low quality, limited choice, no fresh fruit, cakes were not fresh.and a very limited range of food on offer,waiter hopeless *Too much money for a room with No outside windows, and the rooms had paper thin walls.15m2 rooms *Deluxe room pantheon view had half a window - don't be fooled by their photo. A very narrow strip of room leading to it. The rest of the room was behind a wall so you couldn't even see the room from your bed. *You can't see out the windows at all and there was no natural light. It is like being in a windowless room which felt a little claustrophobic. You had to have a light on at all times. *The bathroom was unbelievably tiny and cramped, not even 1 metre wide. You couldn't even turn in it and a large person would not have fit. *The employees should know how to communicate with customers.Staff uniform untidy dirty. *The restaurant that was advertising 15% discount charged 5 euro to use 2 serviettes for lunch which almost negated the discount.Avoid restaurant below despite pasta uncooked & overpriced for quality. *General cleanness was poor. *Wireless internet is available but the signal is not strong as it should be, and difficulties with access to internet. *Hotel had not even a name outside. *Room insulation poor could hear people in room next door. At the end we stayed 3 stars hotel (Albergo Santa Chiara) instead of this horrible hotel and it was half of the price of Pantheon Royal Suite.We had a big room, and excellent breakfast. Staff was really good.More comfortable hotel & shower you could actually use & enjoy at!!!! I strongly recommend anyone to AVOID this hotel. Regards

Reviews.Title: “depends on the room”
Reviews.Author: saskia h
Reviews.Content: we booked a standard room, but for the price we were expecting something fantastic. We were given a room on the first floor which is where breakfast is served. the room was tiny and not soundproofed at all and we hardly slept, we were really dissapointed and went to speak to the Elisabetta in the morning. she suggested looking at another room on the 3rd fllor which was much better- and when we asked if there was anything with a bath- she showed us a brilliant room with a bed which lifts up to the ceiling with a double jacuzzi underneath- she also did us a great deal so hardly paid anything for the upgrade- so slept very well and loved the location. the breakfast is not good at all and the staff ignore you. if it wasnt for Elisabetha and the upgraded room it couldve been horrible and a waste of money- instead it was very special with the jacuzzi and a great location

Reviews.Title: “Location amazing, staff friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: jimjan69
Reviews.Content: The location was amazing, stepping straight out to a view of the pantheon and within easy walking distance of most sites. Staff were very friendly and helpful and desk was manned 24 hours Room was clean and comfortable and had been newly refurbished, although you may feel a bit clostraphobic as they are compact and are quite dark

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Very small rooms!”
Reviews.Author: smokymtnguest
Reviews.Content: Location is phenomenal..just steps from the Pantheon. But the piazza can get very noisy and crowded. Rooms are incredibly small..very deceptive photos on the website! Would probably not stay here again. Nowhere to put your clothes, etc..too cramped and it was just my husband and I! The only plus side was the location, everything within walking distance. Beds were very hard and uncomfortable, complimentary breakfast was the same every day. Staff in breakfast room were rude. Staff at outside restaurant very friendly and helpful. There are too many hotels to choose from that have better rooms and quieter nights to have to squeeze into rooms that are probably less than 200sf!

Reviews.Title: “PLEASE STAY AWAY!!! Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: F L
Reviews.Content: Please stay away. Apart from the fact that it is bang on in the middle of the city. The hotel has nothing else to offer. The hotel is a far cry from what you see on the website. The pcitures have been cleverly taken to deceive guests. The rooms are very small and far from homely. Worst hotel experience ever. Sad it was our honeymoon. Spent 770EUR on the best suite for 3 nights and it was pathetic. Round dream room they called it. Had to take elevators which felt like a death trap from the bottom of the room to the top. The room was so small we had to leave most of our belongings on the floor. The breakfast was also pathetic!! My wife cried the first night. The sound proofing was so bad you could actually hear people talking on the pantheon. When we complained about this, the hotel manager said "what do you expect from booking a hotel within the Pantheon square". the staff where unfriendly and rude. Our welcome gift was a cheap bottle of cava!!! they couldn;t even afford to give a decent bottle of champagne. And when we asked for a refund after the first night so we could move to the Radisson Blu or another hotel within the same price range, we were told we couldn't get a refund despite our complaints and the irritation. The annoying thing was the decline was done in a very unfriendly and rude manner. The staff walked around with an attitude. I have never reviewed on trip advisor but I had to after this horrific experience. I strongly recommend anyone to avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Shirlwirly
Reviews.Content: Small room staff in Resturant not interested in clients prefared to watch TV which was on very loud and of no interest

Reviews.Title: “Wont stay in Pantheon again”
Reviews.Author: gary f
Reviews.Content: The Pantheon was very small and unwelcoming, various problems with the use of credit cards in hotel. Breakfasts were very poor, cold and cutlery etc dirty. Had to be the worst hotel i ever stayed in. Rooms were small and every word could be heard from adjoining rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location & Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mia711
Reviews.Content: The Hotel's concept is great. The staff is friendly and really helpful. The location of the hotel is great as it is close to the main attractions of Rome by walk. And it is located in front of one of the most beautiful attraction of Rome the Pantheon :) The rooms are very spacious, clean and with nice furniture. Great experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Tim S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our first visit to Rome towards the end of a three week Europe vacation. The first thing that makes this hotel stand out is its location. Right in the Pantheon square you are staying in a place where all sorts of visitors are coming to see. You can walk in any direction to see almost all the sights of Rome. I booked the Round Room many months before coming and had forgotten about it. Nice surprise upon arrival The room is awesome and I highly recommend it to anyone visiting. You get a private lift to the top floor of the building which is dedicated to the one room. It has two terraces, a nice TV, and the mini bar is complimentary. For the money, it was the best value I think we got in Europe. The WiFi in this building was very good, stable and fast. Best I had experienced on my trip until this date. The staff was helpful and friendly. The breakfast was pretty good but not as good as some of the other hotels we stayed at on our trip. The two negatives I had for this hotel were the mediocre A/C for the room we were staying in and the lack of toiletry amenities. The room was a bit warm at most times even with the A/C fully cranked. This was a typical thing we experienced all over Europe but definitely wished we could have kept the room a bit cooler. For the bathroom, they provide no bar soap or hair conditioner and didn't refill our used shampoo and shower gel bottles after the first day until we called to request it. Still, it gets 5 stars since we really enjoyed our time and the room. I would stay here again if I went back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HezzieD
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights in this lovely central hotel with a view of the Pantheon, amazing! The room size was average for Italy, but nice and comfortable bed (we slept well) and modern with flat screen TV on the wall and air conditioning well hidden behind a picture on the wall! The bathroom was very compact and could hardly move in it, but it was very clean and modern too with a nice shower and bidet. The location was very central to everything that we wanted to see and was about 15 mins walk from most attractions. There were lots of little restaurants scattered around the main square outside the hotel, so didnt have to venture far to get something to eat! We did find some cheaper resturants down the side streets though and the food was much better in big portions! The hotel served a buffet style breakfast and was a good variety on the first day of cereal, cold meats, croissants or a cooked breakfast - however it was the same every day unfortunately. Overall it was a nice hotel and I would probably go back. They provide an airport transfer on the way home that was 55 euros, in a very nice clean car, compared to standard 60 euros charge on the way in, in a standard cab outside the airport that was a bit shabby!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but...”
Reviews.Author: IrisCZ
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location right next to Pantheon and is pretty close to anything in the historical centre. Piazza della Rotonda is a lively place with people entertaining all day round and the square is packed with people from dawn to dusk. The reception staff was very nice and helpful, our room however was a bit of let down, although it was modern and clean, it was rather small and our window was whitened as it led to nowhere so I was missing the view but again, probably only the best (most expensive) rooms get the view on the square. On our first night we had terrible sleep as this hotel is not very soundproof and you can hear absolutely everything, people coming back late in the night, staff talking in the corridors etc. Breakfast service is not the best, as most of the days eggs, bacon, sausages were cold, because the heater wasn't on while the staff was chatting. Overall the location is good, rooms clean and modern but wouldn't stay here again. We came back with mixed feelings about Rome as there is rubbish and scaffolding everywhere which makes it harder if you want to take nice pictures. Also sadly to say, the best Italian meal I ever had I had in England. Restaurants round Pantheon and Piazza Navona are quite dear and food quality not very good, except their gelato as that can't be beaten anywhere in the world:-)

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate room, great view and location”
Reviews.Author: brianalfredridge
Reviews.Content: We loved our view of the Pantheon and the piazza. We could easily walk bus or taxi anywhere in Rome quickly and simply. There is a taxi stand in the square which was convenient. Elisabetta at the desk speaks 5 languages and helped me print tickets to the Vatican museum to avoid the lines. Our clean air-conditioned room was our oasis to rest hot tired feet. Breakfast was included and saved time and money. Attached restaurant had the best lasagna we had in our ten days in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great price.”
Reviews.Author: Pecos28
Reviews.Content: Great, modern hotel. Good service, nice, updated rooms. The best part is the location. Get a room with a view onto the square and you have a view of the Pantheon. Close walk to everywhere in Rome. Best location!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: christofferb79
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel which is newly renovated, with a super convenient location for all of you who want to discover Rome. We spent our honeymoon here and are very satisfied. The staff was very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: pippo29
Reviews.Content: despite the good location (even if it is just above a restaurant...) the room was awful, with no windows, no view and extremely small. You feel claustrophobic in that room and we left right away as was impossible to stay or sleep. Elevator very small and need to do three trails to bring luggages to the room. Never again

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here every time and pay for the view!”
Reviews.Author: urskelly
Reviews.Content: I was in Rome for 2 nights, but this hotel made me want to stay for more. Driving in to the city I was worried that finding an address in Rome would not be easy. However, given that the hotel is located next to a landmark, it was a breeze. Just follow signs for the Pantheon and you're there, no worries. We were greeted at the front desk by Sara, who is friendly, competent and efficient. Check in took seconds, we were up in our room in no time with a map and wifi access in hand. The room was clean and fresh and the ceilings were super high with wood beams. No complaints at all about the general room. The BEST FEATURE of the room was the window that opened to the Piazza below, which we kept open at all times when we were inside. You can see and hear the life of Rome this way and I would recommend paying the extra charge for this, it is worth it. The Piazza had restaurants, sandwich shops, a pharmacy/convenient store, an electronics store all right there so we didn't have to travel far when we realized we had forgotten our iphone charger and our Motrin ;) A bottle opener and then later an iron/board was sent up promptly when requested- no problems. We walked to all the sights; the Vatican, P. Navona, Trevi Ftn, Colosseum, etc... with ease. Nightlife is great in this area also, and I felt safe walking around at 2-3 am (in heels). There is only one other time I have been so satisfied with a hotel stay, and it was at a resort rather than a boutique hotel like this is.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel-disappointing as I had expected something special for the price”
Reviews.Author: Lovely-Mary
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were going to Rome and decided to book this hotel as a treat. How disappointing!!!!The only positives were the very friendly and helpful reception staff Sara and Alex, and the view of the Pantheon OUTSIDE. We were in a internal room with NO VIEW. The windows only opened a few millimeters.....Not as advertised. Will I go back....Yes to Rome but not to the Pantheon Royal Suite.

Reviews.Title: “Small Boutique Hotel with a great View”
Reviews.Author: Romevaccation
Reviews.Content: We arrived with great expectation to stay at the Pantheon Royal Suite, The room was to small for us and Lovely Elizabetha on the Reception changed our room the next day to a slightly larger room, the rooms are plain and classy fresh and clean. The staff are friendly and helpful, the Breakfast is Ok but not to a 4 star standard the waiters in the breakfast room where a little rude when we asked for a soft boiled egg, which they not seam to get together, Breakfast for us is the most important meal of the day and should be a pleasure not a hazel, it sets the mood of the day for anyone with a little higher standard. We would recommend this Hotel to future Guests for a short stay only then the noise at night on the Square was a little to much if your looking for a good nights rest, we stayed for 8 nights which was a mistake on our behalf, for short stays it is perfect to walk to all sight seeing sites. The price was on the high site and should have been discounted for a longer stay. P W

Reviews.Title: “Great 13th birthday trip with my daughter!”
Reviews.Author: Paul3310
Reviews.Content: We just spent 6 nights at the Pantheon Royal Suite and had a great time. The hotel's central location is easily within walking distance of most of Rome's sites. Our room overlooking the Pantheon and the piazza and fountain was incredible. Breakfast was delicious. The front desk staff was always helpful. Thank you Alex and Sara for making our stay with you so nice! I don't think you will be disappointed with this hotel. Paul and Sophia Texas U.S.A.

Reviews.Title: “Keep away from this hotell!!!”
Reviews.Author: Roaldspc
Reviews.Content: This is our worst hotell experience ever. The first room we got (103) was small and claustrofobic and without window. We changed room after one night but this room (301) was not much better. It was very small with a view towards a dirty narrow backyard. The aircondition was ot of order and there where no air in the room. The bathroom was very thiny and rotten (distroyd by water) and the smell in the room was very unplesant. I will not recomend any of my friend to stay at this hotell. Not my enemies either! It nearly destroyed our stay in Roma. Keep away!!!! Very bad value for money. Expensive and bad. We dont recognies any of the other reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Round Dreams - great room and location!”
Reviews.Author: JaayMac
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews for the hotel and my main concern was noise - a few emails back and forth to the very friendly staff allowed me to make sure I selected a room for which this would be less of an issue... and what a room! We asked for the "Round Dreams" room which is on top of the hotel. Good sized room, comfortable beds and the best part? Two great terraces - one with a table and chair which could be used to eat lovely pizza or sandwiches from the square below. The other had sun loungers and a jacuzzi - quite good in March, but they would be amazing in the even warmer weather. Finally both overlooking the Pantheon and the square below - great location - you could look around the sites and pop back to the room for a rest and head out again. The hotel itself was relatively basic, but I knew this when I booked and the location and room was what I booked for and I got what I wanted! In summary? We had a great stay and I would stay in this room / hotel again if I was on Holiday in Rome again...

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, even greater staff”
Reviews.Author: kthrockm
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are staying in the hotel now as I write this review. We have been very happy despite some minor bumps. The rooms are small and perhaps a little claustrophobic to Americans accustomed to larger rooms in the states, but guess what? Rome is an ancient city and space is at a premium! Get over it! They have made good use of the space available. We love the room we have and the location. From here you can walk to the colosseum or to Vatican City. Evenings are great with the Piazza Della Rotunda outside you door. Music and food, spirits, all right here. As I type this I hear the sounds of the city coming in through the window and enjoy it. Very clean, cool boutique hotel styling and a jacuzzi under the bed. The equal of US boutique hotels like the Hotel George on Columbus Square in D.C. In addition to all of that, the staff is top notch. Alex, Sara and Elizabeth have been great and have done all they can to make our stay a great one.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, finally, i find a place to comeback in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: danielaguerrero1
Reviews.Content: Hi, i stay in this Hotel with my boyfriend, he came to Rome, for make a photo report of Italy, then we stay 2 nights, so we need a quiet, comfortable and central place in Rome, and we book this hotel with a little bit of afraid, be cause all the 5 times we was in Rome, the attention have been terrible in the hotels, and you can find 4 stars hotel's wich look like 2 stars (and paying for a 4 stars!), with everything old, unconfortable bed or 2 beds together to try to make a big one, wich it's completely unconfortable, and unhelpful and/or staff in bad mood. So this hotel it's completely new, with a very modern decoration, ONE BIG BED! our room has a wonderfull view of the Pantheon, in the very heart of rome, quiet, good breakfast, very good Room Service, we take dinner the 2 nights we stay in the hotel, and the food was a very good quality and very honest for an hotel in the center of Rome, but the most importanto for us, a WONDERFUL STAFF. I even forget some things in the hotel, and they saved for me (usually, when i forget something in the hotel, i never see it again). So finally, we find a home to comeback in Rome. Amazing, i don't have words.

Reviews.Title: “Most disappointing stay of six weeks in Europe :-(”
Reviews.Author: Garth_Fiona
Reviews.Content: We booked this place as the highlight for the end of six-week tour through Europe - we couldn't have been more disappointed. Their website is VERY misleading in terms of the rooms: our "Rafaello" room was supposed to have an "internal view" - instead it had no view at all; mainly because there was only one tiny frosted window which barely even opened! (see Photo 1). Very claustrophobic atmosphere and not at all the premium room we had expected from their marketing. On top of that, we had a paper-thin connecting door adjoining us to the next bedroom (Photo 2) - also not mentioned on their website on booking, and we could hear the guy next door talking on the phone, blowing his nose etc. We complained about the adjoining door to the staff on-check in and were lied to by the staff who said the room was empty. On complaining again, we were told in a very dismissive fashion that they could do nothing about it - so much for helpful staff... The room was tiny. Especially the bathroom/toilet, which a larger person would find it impossible to use (as commented on by other reviewers) - see Photo 3. The bed was hard up against all the walls and we could barely get round it to go to sleep. On looking for spare pillows, we found DISGUSTING stained pillows were provided for us (Photo 4) - not used, naturally. Room decor in general was very ordinary, despite their flash website (Photo 5). For a country that loves and prides itself on food, the breakfast was very, very basic and we couldn't even finish it. On top of all this the hotel is STILL being renovated. Don't believe the comments that the works are finished: they were definitely not in October 2010. We were awoken by a workman hammering on the wall right outside our door and angle grinders were running during the day. Considering we paid top dollar for this hotel, it was not even remotely near what we expected. The only positive thing it had going for it was the fantastic location right on the Pantheon. We would definitely not recommend this place to anyone looking to treat themselves with premium accommodation in Rome - don't believe their glossy website!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: McDonald88
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for new year 2010. I had booked this hotel without reading the reviews first. I was quite downhearted once I had read the reviews however I have learnt a valuable lesson which is to make your own mind up about a place. The hotel was fantastic. We stayed in deluxe room which had a dubble juccuzi underneath the bed, it was quite impressive. We had a fantastic view from our double window. You could open the windows totally out and listen to the entertainers in the square, it was fabulous. On new years eve, we received a complimentary bottle of champagne and bath bomb which I thought was quite a nice touch. Staff were very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. If you have ever been to Rome before, you will know that all hotel rooms are a lot smaller than in the UK or America. Visited Rome in 2009 and stayed in a hotel which cost twice as much as this one and the rooms were around the same size. They have a restaurant as you come out of the hotel and to the right where you receive 15% off your total bill if you are a guest at the hotel. The food is delicious. The one negative point I would like to make is that there is no sign on the outside of the hotel with the hotel name on, we had to ask one of the waiters in the square's cafe where the hotel was however he showed us straight to it. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “ridiculous decor that truly hindered enjoyment of our stay for christmas holiday in rome”
Reviews.Author: tuxedoSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: This is a case of hotel pictures modified by photoshop to make the wide angle lens perspective not so obvious. These are tiny tiny rooms which in the pictures look beautiful; modern decor that in reality is terrible. For example a bed hung from the ceiling by wires that one assends to by 10 glass stairs, very dangerous for anyone over 25 years of age should you want to go to the bathroom in the middle of the night. Or a bed over a hot tube which has only about 15 inches of room around the bed to access the bathroom, or a small bedroom which has no windows and the bathroom has a toilet bowl 1/2 inch from the wall on one side very uncomfortable toilet experience for the price medium price 250euros!! We complained and the staff brought a large picture of the view we could not see!!! This is a hotel that remoleded and should never have done so. It is preposterous decor that makes for uncomfortable stays. Our family had two rooms and both felt we over paid for uncomfortable experiences. sorry to say but we dont recommend at all.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - walking distance to everything in Rome”
Reviews.Author: lou6162
Reviews.Content: I actually booked this hotel for my parents for their wedding anniversary and was not disappointed. The location was perfect - right beside the Pantheon so it was always easy to find on maps or to ask anyone but they never had to. The hotel was really clean and the rooms were a bit on the small side but I think that is just the way with hotels in Rome for the amount of tourists. The staff were unbelievably helpful - I had called in advance to ask if there was an opportunity to ugrade rooms that it would be appreciated and while they could not upgrade they did provide a complimentary bottle of wine! The staff also spoke perfect English and were really helpful in directing us to many tourist attractions and where to get tour buses and booked some trips for us. The restaurant there is also really nice - a bit on the pricey side but fine for one night as there are so many other restaurants around Rome to check out also. There was a taxi rank outside the hotel which was really handy, and about a 20 min nice walk to the Vatican, about a 10 min walk at most to the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. The area was really safe and there were plenty of police around througout our stay in Rome. I would definatley recommend the hotel for the staff and location alone!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, Small room with paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: Oiledhingessis
Reviews.Content: The Pantheon Royal Suite is in a fabulous location within walking distance to all major attractions in Rome. The staff were friendly and helpful. The second floor is still under construction but because we were out sightseeing during the daytime it really didn't have any impact on our stay however it would if you were a late sleeper. The room was clean and very compact as one would expect being in an older building in central Rome. We found the bed to be firm but comfortable. Our only concern was about privacy. Guests should be aware that the walls in this hotel are paper thin, on our first night the couple in the room next door were having sex and we could literally hear EVERYTHING.... not exactly a romantic situation for us, more like a bad X-rated movie, fortunately the situation was short-lived and it certainly emphasized the need for caution with our own privacy! Basic conversation from the room next-door is completely audible. The hotel restaurant downstairs is overpriced even with the guest discount but there are many other places nearby to eat just as well for less. Overall we had a good stay and would certainly recommend this hotel for the location alone.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: RDPMontreal
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Pantheon Royal suite in early October. The location is fabulous, a step away from the Pantheon and major Rome attractions. However, the hotel room was extremely small, very bare, the bed mattress was very uncomfortable, there is no reception/lounge area, definitely not worth the price. We found out only after we checked out that the non alcoholic drinks in the room are complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “A Palace in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ghtraveler22
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best in Rome. It has the best location and the staff was very friendly. We could walk to numerous restaurants and shops while enjoying the sights. The Pantheon is LITERALLY your front yard. There is always something going on so you can sit by the fountain and simply people watch. The live performers add to the charm of this hotel. You can open your window and let the room fill with beautiful music. My husband and I stayed in the newly renovated pent house suite which has two rooftop balconies and a beautiful outdoor jacuzzi for two. The bed was round and comfy and the bathroom was spacious and luxurious. It is perfect for couples who want a romantic get away and honeymooners. The second time we stayed in this hotel we stayed in the swim dream room which was simply amazing because it was so unique. The bed literally was suspended from the ceiling. This hotel is a little pricey but well worth it if you want something special.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: 5Bidaho
Reviews.Content: I'm quite easy to please and don't consider myself to be too picky, but I would never recommend this hotel... The only plus to this reservation was the drivers to and from the airport are professional, kind, and knowledgable about Rome. The hotel itself is poorly run, the rooms are very dirty, and if you do not have a Pantheon view from your room you are basically shoved into a small cubbyhole-sized room with no windows. I would definitely recommend the location. Any other hotel close to the Pantheon is the way to go... Walking distance to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and very nice accommodations.”
Reviews.Author: AmesFL
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Pantheon Royal Suite on Sept 18th. We were dropped off by the shuttle service arranged through Expedia. We managed to get a fairly priced package, round trip between Paris and Rome which included air, lodging and transportation. Its a good thing the shuttle driver knew exactly which door we should enter for the hotel as there is no signage beyond #7 Piazza Della Rotonda to indicate you have found the place. That settled, I like the anonymity this provided. Our room was spotlessly clean, the bed very firm and the shower very tiny. My husband is 6' 210 lbs and it was impossible to get the soap off the floor (this was also hilarious). Our view of the piazza fountain and the Pantheon was PRICELESS. There were a couple issues with the card key entry so we were initially given a regular key. A day or so later we lost power in the room, we were provided a card key to install in the wall when you are in the suite and from then on zero issues. We no longer needed the real key for entry. Breakfast was fresh with espresso on request, juices, pastries, lunch meat and cheese. I got a little tired of salami sandwiches after 3 days and wanted my usual oats, but all we were served was very good. Make note that the restaurant at the foot of the entry to the hotel is rather expensive, even with the 15% discount you receive as a hotel guest. After carefully reviewing the bill I noticed that the restaurant had not given us the discount, after bringing this to their attention the situation was rectified. Made me wary and I didn't eat there again. The room service at the hotel is provided by this restaurant, but with so many phenomenal places to eat in Rome, why eat in the room? My thanks and gratitude go out to Elisabetta at the front desk for her assistance in setting up shuttle pick ups, tour reservations and having terrific customer service skills. We never had any issues with her even though we speak zero Italian. She was terrific. I would love to return to Rome and would stay back at this hotel in a heartbeat. Oh I nearly forget, the street performers at the piazza were wonderful~ my favorite was a tenor singing opera to the masses - he got my evening rose...Bravo.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location (best in Rome), new rooms!”
Reviews.Author: g3300
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 nights, rooms are almost all renovated (I don't know if they are still renting the non renovated rooms, I suggest to ask for new rooms anyway). Staff is very friendly (Sara is very helpfull and friendly). Rooms are beautiful but a little bit small, especially the bathroom. The only problem was the dust, I think due to the renovation works, there was a lot of dust comming from the air conditioner.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: Clwalker22
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nites here late August. Had 2 rooms for 2 couples- both were on Floor 3 in Minerva style rooms. These were very small (we had 2 large luggage bags and there wasn't enough space on the floor for both without blocking your access off to each side of the bed). the bathroom was also one of the smallest we had on a 5 week european holiday. As our rooms had no view over the Piazza noise was not an issue, although during the day construction was occurring on a lower floor in the hotel but this didn't affect us at all. Breakfast was provided each morning, but choice was lacking in cereals and spreads for bread (only cornflakes and apricot jam provided). Benefits were room controlled air con- a big plus in the 34 degree heat. The front desk staff were also very polite and informative. Free internet was available thru wi-fi or from a computer in the breakfast room. Was in a great location- right on Piazza Della Rotunda- Pantheon straight out the front door, Piazza Navona a couple blocks away and all the historical sights within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Everything wonderful in a nutshell”
Reviews.Author: murtleturtle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have have a guest house in Camps Bay and are rather fussy about cleanliness, service and location - this place ticks all the boxes. We loved our stay here. On arrival we were greeted by Sara, who was friendly and helpful right from the start. We were surprisingly upgraded to the most perfect room, clean linen, beautiful decor and the view of the Pantheon to die for. Our bed was such a talking point, as you could push a button and the bed would rise up with a welcoming reward of a jacuzzi underneath, sheer bliss, fun and romantic, but then again that is what Rome is all about. We stayed here for 4 nights after a chilling time with a group of friends in Orvietto and we loved every moment of staying here. The Pantheon Suites is a perfect place to explore the whole of Ancient Rome and to step back into history. I would recommend this place to anyone, don't even ask questions, just book and stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Very Disappointing at the same time!”
Reviews.Author: Dani_in_Rome
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small clean and standard level. Great to walk out on one of the world's most famous piazzas. And the positive side stops about there. Works are still being completed in the building, the service and personnel need to learn manners to accomodate guests and to welcome new people to the hotel. Try to avoid Elizabetta, Very rude and maybe take for granted that they are on Piazza della Rotonda and that there are many other hotels in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: voyageuseboreale
Reviews.Content: The biggest bonus regarding this hotel is the location - it is central to everything and we were literally able to walk to all the sites in Rome with ease and come back to the hotel throughout the day to freshen up or rest during the heat of the day. Pros: The hotel was very clean, had a great little breakfast room with a perfect view of the Pantheon, the A/C in our room was fabulously cool, there was a fridge in our room, as well as robes, slippers and big towels. Cons: No signage identifying the hotel from the outside (be sure to arrive with the address in hand). Our room (room 305) did not have a real window, just a little window that was very high and was only open to the hallway - we could hear a lot of street noise at times as well as other guests coming and going. I would still recommend this hotel to anyone and would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, clean room, friendly and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: msmonte10
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a deluxe room with spa that overlooked the Piazza. The view and location were fantastic. Walking distance to most tourist spots. The spa was in an unusual spot- literally under the bed. The bed raises with the push of a button and hangs suspended over the spa. We were a little wary of using the spa for fear of the bed falling on us. Wouldn't pay the extra for spa again. Overall room was clean and nicely furnished. The complimentary mini bar was a nice little extra - wine, beer, mineral water and fruit juice provided. Breakfast was very basic, but enough to get you going for the day. We found it best to explore the many little side streets for cafe's/restaurants, as the one's in the Piazza are overpriced. The BEST restaurant we can recommend for the best pizza, service and value for money, is Rosso Pomodoro, follow Via Di Torre Argentina till you get to a T intersection with a set of lights. Cross the road, Rosso Pomodoro on right....a 10min walk from hotel, and the BEST gelato at The Cremeria, also on Via Di Torre Argentina, only a few minutes walk, opposite the Pantheon.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recomended!”
Reviews.Author: Lindsey325
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Hotel in May 2010 for five nights and really thought it was great, despite some of the earlier reviews about the refurbishments. However we did email the Hotel before booking to confirm the refurbishments had been completed and they promptly replied confirming they had. You couldn't fault the location at all, being next to the Pantheon you can't get any more central if you tried. We stayed in one of the cheapest rooms on the back of the Hotel (so no view) and yes it wasn't the biggest room ever, but how much time do you actually spend in your room whist in Rome and we have stayed in one much smaller in Venice. The Hotel was really clean and we had fresh bedding every day and the rooms were spotlessly clean. One day the milk had not been replaced in our room, but we just asked and the staff brought it straight away. The shower in our room was separate from the toilet and sink, but this didn't cause us any problem, however the couple that we went with stayed on the third floor and their room was a different lay out to ours and the shower was with the toilet and sink. The free Wifi was great with this Hotel as when we were in our room we managed to watch our telly at home via the Sling box using the free internet access. We would have no problems recommending this Hotel to anyone and if we ever go back to Rome again (hopefully we will) we will stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, excellent rooms, friendly staff and great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Mainiac39
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for 5 nights at the beginning of May. The location is impossible to beat. It is conveniently located in the middle of everything. The Pantheon is literally only a few steps away and the Piazza Navona, Trevi Fountain, and Spanish Steps just a couple of blocks away. The room wasn't especially roomy (OK, it was really small) but it was beautiful, new, and clean. I had booked the trip, then checked the reviews and I was nervous about all of the construction, bad breakfast, and loud noise comments. While there appears to be a bit of construction still under way in the building, we didn't hear or see any at all. The breakfast was offered in the hotel by the restaurant downstairs. We had fresh fruit, meat, cheese, croissant, breakfast pastry, coffee, team orange juice, etc. There was plenty of delicious food. The hotel is very modern with high ceilings and exposed beams in the rooms. The only complaint that I had is that when people in the room above us moved the chairs and luggage it was loud in our room. Not even close to a deal breaker, though. In fact, it was fun in some ways. My husband I awoke at 2am to the sound of expensive Italian shoes clicking down the hall whistling the theme to "The Godfather". It was a good laugh. We had an excellent stay at the Pantheon Royal Suite. p.s. The elevator is small but it works.

Reviews.Title: “Charming on all accounts -- location, room, people”
Reviews.Author: Guychuk
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay - the room was simply lovely and everybody in the staff very welcoming and friendly. Room facing the Piazza was incredible -- and the window had great sealing so no noise came in from the bustling activity in the restaurants and the fountain below. I would gladly return again to the Piazza della Rotonda and this charming place!

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto!!”
Reviews.Author: DolceS
Reviews.Content: Construction has finished!! And what a superb location this hotel is situated, right in front of The Pantheon!! Our initial booking was the classic room, but after a nights sleep my girlfriend found it extremely claustrophobic, the frosted windows did not open and the toilet in the bathroom was confined to a narrow space (luckily we are both slim!!) I was interrupted by a guests snoring next door.. So we did have to complain to the lady behind the desk. She did suggest another room with a jacuzzi under the bed as described on another post, but upon inspection the window did not open and the room was very small, so we declined.. She then gave us a room with a large window opening towards the main square, and it was just beautiful and airy, with no extra cost!! The bathroom was extremely small so I can't recommend it to overweight people or elderly people!! The elevator works and the hotel in general is very modern with free wifi.. The breakfast was just wonderful, and you also get a 15% discount at the adjoining restaurant.. I would recommend this hotel to younger couples, it is just 5minutes walk to Campo de Fiori, and 15 minutes walk to Collesseum.. Be sure to bring your reservation confirmation as you will get invoiced for your stay! Be sure to clarify everything.. In general I found Rome very expensive, and its not a clubbing city! Although if you need to escape and get lost for a few days in a city full of ancient architecture, well this is the city for you!! I also found a terrific taxi service that drove us from FCO airport to my hotel for €17.50 pp.. I hope this is helpful and if anyone needs photos of the rooms, well just ask!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Be aware Pantheon Royal Suites is not accepting reservations from mid November to Beginning of January!!”
Reviews.Author: UTinEurope
Reviews.Content: We had a reservation for December 8- 14 and I just received an email telling me that the hotel will be finishing construction and our reservation was cancelled. We no longer have a hotel for our trip in less than 4 weeks...

Reviews.Title: “Best location, friendly service, would stay again with earplugs”
Reviews.Author: MXW9
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a three night stay at the Pantheon Royal Suite (who thought of that name?) - and apart from what other travelers have said (no lift, but apparently coming this month, so keep checking with them, and still a building site in places i.e. around the stairwell) it was a very good place to stay. We did not notice any of the building works in terms of noise and the builders kept the stairs very clean while working on the sidelines and the stairs as such were save. Reception is on third floor and they were always very friendly and helpful and even arranged for a very late checkout on the Sunday. On arrival, they immediately apologized for the stairs/absence of lift and were quite astounded to hear that I knew about it. Lift is being installed sometime November apparently. All further questions regarding Rome or the room where dealt with immediately and a free water bottle was replaced straight away as the seal seemed to be broken. Room 304 is with Pantheon view, a deluxe double room, not huge per se but big bed with a firm mattress, but all very clean and new and enough space for two, clear design nothing to annoy the tastebuds. Bathroom not huge, particularly the showertray is tiny, so might feel a squeeze for some. Plenty of towels and good water pressure and lots of hot water. No plug for handbasin, so not sure what people do if wet shave. Good hair dryer and very nice Mila Schoen toiletries (plenty, including two toothbrushes). Safe in warddrobe worked and the fridge was stocked minimally (which means you can stock up yourself) but all clean and new. Could have done with more hangers but forgot to ask. The bedlinen is very nice but if it is getting cooler the bed throw will not be enough to keep you warm. Air con in room but did not use. The pictures on the website show the room as it is. Sensational view which really is quite breathtaking at all times of the day. A full moon over the Pantheon is quite something! Good double glazed windows but if you like to leave them open at night, bring ear plugs as the piazza is very busy and therefore noisy until the early hours of the morning and at about 5-6am the street cleaners come to empty the bins. All fine with windwos closed though! Adding to the streetnoise is the running water noise of the beautiful fountain outside the window! Next time I bring ear plugs. Good Samsung flat screen TV and Sky channels. One negative point: The hotel needs to do sth about the badly insulated wall to our neighbours and the keycard buzzer to our neighbours door. It is quite loud and you can hear most of the conversation in the other room which was the annoying part (one night out of three). Again, ear plugs would have solved the problem. Breakfast is in the bar/coffee shop/restaurant downstairs (does not belong to hotel) and has improved somewhat from previous reports: super coffee, hot chocolate or any hot drink, buffet with different baked good (rolls, croissants, cake) one variety of cheese and ham, cereals, milk, yoghurt and fresh fruit basket. You can eat inside or out. If you return to eat another meal during the day there you will get a 20% discount in this place. Location: you cannot top the location, that is for sure. Everything is in walking distance from there: Piazza Navona and Campo dei Fiori round the corner, shopping district/Corso, even the Vatican or the Castle St Angelo is very close 10-20min. We did two guided tours with Angel Tours (one of which was the tour on a golf cart/buggy) and both were sensational and very informative but fun. (see Angel Tours Rome recommended on TripAdvisor). Shame we did not have time for their Vatican tour. We also use the red open top bus company (which was good for a general overview on the first day) and they were good and not as bad as some reviews on this site. If you have kids and want to show them a lot, Eur15 well spent for 24h. We will definitely stay again at the hotel, next time in one of their family appartments which have kitchenette and sleep 4. The lift will be a massive improvement. More rooms are being done in different styles - one apparently with a jaccuzzi. If the management keeps up the cleanliness and friendlyness and the general basic concept of a good unfussy hotel in a superb location with all the right basics, then this is a place I am happy to return to time and time again. Around the corner is a very well stocked Spar supermarket (next door to it is the best ice cream shop - and cheaper than most of the big name ones! Try the Lemoncello variety) with a good deli counter, so ideal to self-cater for some of the stay. They even had glutenfree produce/breads/ snacks which was fab. They also sell earplugs I noticed on my last trip. ;-).

Reviews.Title: “A unique location that you will never forget!”
Reviews.Author: Reiziger71
Reviews.Content: The greatest thing about this hotel is it's location! It is situated at the Piazza della Rotonda, one of the most intimate piazzas of Rome. We stayed in a deluxe room, with view right at the Pantheon. If you opened the window in the morning after waking up, the Pantheon was right there, how unique is that?! It was great to see the piazza changing through the day. When you looked out of the window in the middle of the night the piazza was completely empty. In the morning during breakfast the piazza was slowly waking up, in the afternoon it was crowed with people and not until late at night it was slowly getting more quiet. Disadvantage of this unique location was the fact that it was noisy from very early in the morning. At 6.00 a.m. they started to clean the piazza, to collect the dirt (also the empty bottles, which made a lot of noise) and to deliver to the restaurants. During three nights of our five night stay there arrived a truck at 6.00 a.m. to deliver construction materials for the renovation that was taking place in the building of the hotel. They left the engine running. But the construction workers were very polite to the guests and tried to do there work as quiet as possible. During the day I did not really notice that there was work in progress. We were staying at the 3th floor, where the reception is located. Sometimes late at night or early in the morning you could hear the telephone ringing rather loud, but it was always picked up quickly. The staff at the reception was very friendly. The hotel consist of only rooms. There are no facilities like a restaurant or bar. The hotel is not indicated on the outside. But the Piazza della Rotonda is not very big and when you have seen the pictures on the internet, you will find it easily. There was no lift at the hotel, so we had to carry our luggage up and down three floors. But all this was forgotten when we saw the view from our room! The rooms are very new, so everything looks new an clean. The decoration is very modern and fresh. Its great, especially when you compare it to many other hotels that I have seen on the internet. The room is not big, but big enough as we spent most of our time in the city. The bathroom is rather small as well, especially the shower. But I understand that is normal in most Italian hotels. Towels were changed every day. It was nice to have an airco and a safe in the room. The beds were great, although it was too short for my partner, who has a length of 1.90 meters. The location is great as well because it is really in the center in Rome and right in the middle of all the important sites that you should visit when you are in Rome. The Colosseum an the Vatican are most far away, and even these places can be walked to in 15-20 minutes. Breakfast is being served in the restaurant that is situated downstairs. Breakfast indeed consists of only a cup of coffee (a very big one!) or tea, a glass of orange juice and one croissant. But I learned that this is a normal Italian breakfast. We could use our breakfast on the terrace in front of the restaurant, right at the Piazza della Rotonda, only about twenty steps away from the Pantheon. Really breathtaking! Before breakfast we walked into the Pantheon for a minute, when only a very few people were inside. While later on the day it is crowded with people. Disadvantage was that breakfast is being served from 9.00 a.m. So if you want to start your day in the city early, you will have to skip breakfast. Even though there were some disadvantages, our overall opinion about this hotel is that it is great! We will never forget sleeping at only some meters distance from the impressive Pantheon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, under construction”
Reviews.Author: 1950kazak
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. The room was very new and spacious. The hotel is currently undergoing renovations. There is no elevator and we were given a low floor that fulfilled our request. The room appointments were very good. The room included an area with a comfortable couch. The kitchen area included a small refrigerator, cooktop and microwave. The setup was good for a quick breakfast or lunch. Pots, pans, plates and utensils were all clean and ready for use. The window of our room looked out onto the construction area, but this was not a drawback during this trip. It would be nice to have a room with a view of the Pantheon. Continental breakfast was included in the cafe at the hotel entrance. Keep an eye on this one.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking, DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: axetrip
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE! I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. I was deceived and lied to from the moment I booked to stay at the hotel. The rooms on the Pantheon Suite Website are only the few they have finished. The hotel is still under construction. There is no lift and upon our arrival we had to carry our luggage up to the 3rd floor. There was no bell boy or concierge to help. Upon reaching reception on the 3rd floor we were informed that our room was not ready and that we would be placed in a lesser room for the 1st night and then upgraded for the remaining 3 nights of our stay. We were then told that we would be offered a bottle of Champagne to make up for this, in the end we were only given a bottle of white wine. The room we were placed in was next to reception. It had a window which faced the corridor with no natural light. During the night I was unable to open the window as the noise from reception was too loud. The air conditioning in the room was directly above the bed so I could not turn it on as I did not want to catch a cold. In the end I had a hot, noisy sleepless night. The following day we headed down to breakfast which was all inclusive and supplied by a restaurant on the Pantheon plaza. The breakfast was a coffee and a croissant. On the table next to us a german couple who were also staying in the hotel were complaining about the size of the breakfast. We then spoke to them and found out that they too had been lied to about their rooms. Due to all these factors we decided to check out after just one night as the noise of the building work also started very early. To add insult to injury we were charged 100Euros for the night. I would not stay here again and would never recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing view!”
Reviews.Author: AWoo80
Reviews.Content: I think the last review is very unfair of this hotel. Yes it is still under construction but we stayed on a Friday night and its one of the best night sleeps I have had in a hotel (the bed was very comfy). We paid a little more for a 'deluxe' room with a view right on to the Pantheon- I could have stayed for hours both during the day an night just to people watch!. Believe me, 170 euro is not expensive for a hotel in Rome with this kind of view. There was building work going on, but we heard nothing at all on the Saturday morning. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful and although breakfast was only a croissant and coffee they were delicious and we ate outside over looking the Piazza della Rotonda. The only construction work is in the stair well and on the other floors of the hotel- the floor we were on (which I believe is the only floor they are letting rooms on) was completely finished. The bedroom is very nicely furnished in a very modern style. The bathroom is a little on the small side, but has everything you need and is very clean (with everything being brand new). I would go back in a second, but as another reviewer said its likely the prices will increase when the hotel is finished. If you would like a romantic getaway at an amazingly located hotel, book into this hotel while it still has affordable room rates and pay a little more for a deluxe room- the view and location to all the top sites will not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: clairwilcoxy
Reviews.Content: Returned from this hotel a couple of weeks ago and can honestly say if you have booked to stay here please cancel!!! The photos on the website show the few rooms that are completed but fail to show that it is literally like staying in a building site. You have to climb 3 flights if stairs to get to the reception, which are not even finished so you can see the sky above, and there is banging and drilling from 8am in the morning,,,,NIGHTMARE!!! The rooms are modern but ours despite being a suite was really dark with all windows looking out onto a wall (thats if you could get the window open). More like a dungeon than a suite. When asked to be moved rooms or hotels we were told there was nothing they could do and that the reason it was such a good price was because the hotel was still under construction... I personally dont think £130 a night to be exactly cheap. The one good thing about the hotel is its location which is amazing for seeing the sites, but i would still advise anyone to change hotels if its not too late

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter86Scotland
Reviews.Content: this hotel is probably in the best location for all the major sights with everything within easy walking distance- the vatican and colusseum around 15-20 mins at the most and trevi fountain less than 5 mins. the hotel is in piazza della rotonda, with the pantheon and lots of restaurants right outside. it's not clearly sign posted and doesn't look like an obvious hotel from the outside. if you're facing the pantheon, the hotel is on the right hand side, in between 2 restaurants. it looks like an entrance to a block of flats and reception is on the 3rd floor. they are still doing renovations to the lower floors but there was no noise and we barely noticed it. the hotel consists of only rooms (no public areas eg a bar) and breakfast is served in the restaurant downstairs which is a lovely setting- sitting outside in the square with a view of the pantheon- our room was brand new and immaculate. we had a view onto the square and pantheon which was lovely. the room was small but not tiny and had a king size bed, safe, T.V, minibar/fridge and a built in wardrobe. the bathroom was spotless and modern and was cleaned every day. the reception staff were friendy and helpful. there was no lift that i could see. i could find no fault with this hotel and it's location was definately it's best asset. it's a perfect base from which to explore the city. i would definately invest in a map and guidebook so you don't miss anything. the best pizzaria in rome is around 5-10 mins walk from the hotel and is great (and cheap) it's called Baffato's and is worth a visit. we had to queue but turnaround is very quick so we only waited around 10 mins. similarly, the ice cream place beside the trevi fountain is fab - try the chocolate orange flavour! overall, a great stay in Rome and i wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

HotelInfo.Name: Pantheon Royal Suite
HotelInfo.Address: Piazza Della Rotonda 7, 00186 Rome, Italy
